text: hi it's angel in my last video I showed
you guys how to make a sweet soy milk
and I've got a lot of requests on making
a sweet tofu dessert so in this video
I'm going to show you how to make stoke
watt which is a classic Asian dessert
and you can sometimes find this a dim
sum restaurants but it's one of my
personal favorite desserts so really
excited to be sharing this recipe with
you guys so with that let's get started
first let's start with making our ginger
syrup
we'll need 1 cup of filtered water 1/3
inch piece of ginger a 4 inch piece of
brown sugar slab now if you don't have
brown sugar slab you can also use a few
tablespoons of brown sugar cook all of
those ingredients over medium-low heat
until the sugar dissolves and about half
of the water evaporates this should give
you a nice sweet syrup
feel free to taste tests and add more
sugar or water if needed now because
we're serving this cold I like to let
everything cool then put the ginger
pieces along with the syrup in a jar and
let that infuse overnight in the
refrigerator they'll give it a really
nice gingery flavor next let's make our
sweet tofu we'll need 2 cups of our
homemade soy milk and if you don't feel
like making homemade soymilk that's okay
you can always go to the Asian grocery
store and buy soy ml just make sure to
take a look at the ingredients on the
label
there's nothing else it's in there
besides soybeans water and sugar
anything else in there may not allow the
tofu to set properly we will also need
one tablespoon of water one teaspoon of
cornstarch 1/2 a teaspoon of gypsum
powder now if you're wondering gypsum
powder helps the tofu coagulate and set
while the cornstarch will help thicken
any excess water so with those last
ingredients we'll want to put it in a
large bowl and mix those really well
next we'll go ahead and cook our soy
milk cook the soy milk over medium-low
heat until it starts to boil stir
constantly so it's not burning at the
bottom of the pan and bring it to a boil
for a minute or two to insure it's hot
enough
next give our mixture a quick stir again
before adding our soy milk then quickly
pour in the hot soy milk from about a
foot or so above a bulb using this
technique will help ensure a smooth
silky tofu as everything will start to
coagulate and set very quickly
once you've poured the soymilk resist
the urge to move the bowl we'll want to
let it sit untouched for about 30
minutes just let that cool and then set
that in your refrigerator covered to let
it chill and set up even more once it's
chilled it's ready to serve so I have
some in my fridge that I made last night
now you likely have foam and bubbles on
the top from pouring but that's okay
we're just going to go ahead and skim
off the top foam and see I'm off any
bubbles that remain and then with a
large spoon scoop some big pieces of the
tofu into a smaller bowl and finally top
with a few spoonfuls of the ginger syrup
that we made earlier
so that's it as you can see it was
really easy to make this sweet dessert I
personally like it served cold in the
summer I think it makes for a great
dessert but you could also serve it warm
to it with some of that warm ginger
syrup I hope you guys enjoyed watching
this video and be making this dessert I
have a big sweet tooth so I love making
desserts and sweets do give me a thumbs
up if you'd like to see me make more of
these type of videos and if you're new
to my channel don't forget to subscribe
to my channel in your mom's kitchen for
more Asian and Taiwanese recipes made
simple and fun I'll see you guys next
time bye
